message.content:
1. Fluorescence in situ hybridization uses peptide nucleic acid probes.
2. This technique is referred to as PNA-FISH.
3. PNA-FISH can differentiate Staphylococcus aureus from other bacteria.
4. The other bacteria are Gram-positive-cocci in clusters (GPCC).
5. Staphylococcus aureus is different from other Gram-positive-cocci in clusters.

messages.content:
Statement: Fluorescence in situ hybridization using peptide nucleic acid probes (PNA-FISH) differentiates Staphylococcus aureus from other Gram-positive-cocci in clusters (GPCC).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
